The sky appears blue because of a phenomenon called Rayleigh scattering. When sunlight enters Earth's atmosphere, it encounters molecules and tiny particles in the air. These particles scatter the shorter wavelength blue light more than the longer wavelength red light. This scattered blue light reaches our eyes from all directions, making the sky appear blue to us. It's important to note that this effect is most noticeable during the day when there are more particles in the air and less dust or pollution.

instruct_apology:
Rule-based text processing and deep learning-based text processing are two different approaches to text processing. 

Rule-based text processing involves the use of predefined rules or patterns to analyze and manipulate text data. These rules are typically created by human experts based on their knowledge and experience with the language and domain. The primary purpose of HTML is to provide a standardized way to organize and present information on the web.
